item.title: Daily Cloud Computing News from @cloudfeednet - Mar 3, 2017
item.description:
Daily Cloud Computing news from @cloudfeednet.

The oops that knocked out Amazon Web Services

NEW YORK Amazon (AMZN) says an incorrectly typed command during a routine debugging of its billing system caused the five-hour outage of … more.

3 Reasons Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Stock Will Keep Growing Like a Weed

Perhaps the most compelling reason to put AMZN stock in the growth category is the firm’s cloud computing arm, Amazon Web Services (AWS). more.

Hat OpenStack Platform 8.0 (Liberty). Red Hat Product Security has … more.

Amazon reveals a simple TYPO caused massive server crash that took down

Daily Mail A full restart was required, Amazon said, which took longer than expected due to how fast Amazon Web Services has grown over the past few years. more.

Azure Stack to offer never-ending updates, for a bit less than Azure

Microsoft’s revealed Technical Preview 3 of Azure Stack, its forthcoming on-premises Azure-in-a-box effort, adding some new features, promising a … more.

Fat finger: Typo caused Amazon’s big cloud-computing outage

… typed command during a routine debugging of its billing system caused the five-hour outage of some Amazon Web Services servers on Tuesday. more.

Amazon Web Services said today its outage earlier this week that affected major websites and apps was caused by human error. Sites including … more.
